white noise we used to try everything to get our newborn to sleep one of the best things to do was put her in the carrier and walk in circles around the house living room kitchen dining room back to living room trying to get the right rhythm oh how bad that hurt my knees to try to get that particular hop\ step that she seemed to like so much one day the dishwasher was running in the kitchen and noticed that when walked into the kitchen she quiet down get to the dining room and she start getting loud again then the living room she be crying and the kitchen she be quiet realized it was the noise of the dishwasher adjusted my circles to just go around the kitchen and she was asleep in no time got white noise app on my phone and it made soothing her so much easier did work 100 amp 37 of the time but still lots better than without on at least one occasion as soon as turn on the app she conk right out we wound up getting dedicated white noise machine and she still sleeps with it machine today at yo\ helps keep her from hearing us in the hallway or living room bedroom is on the same floor as most of the house\ we co\ slept for while and when she moved into her own room taking the white noise machine with her\ it was so eerily quiet could no longer sleep so we got duplicate machine for our room seconding the white noise we would cue it up on our phones and she be out like are not breastfeeding do you know understand what to do when your baby needs to clusterfeed agree with everyone else here saying that your baby is overtired but also concerned it may be that the baby is hungry we used preemie nipples which is the lowest flow available because otherwise the baby would eat too much at once breastmilk digests super quickly so you re going to want to be feeding the baby small amounts very frequently also agree that talking to your doctor about colic or acid reflux is very good idea as others have said the baby should be sleeping after being awake for just 45 60 minutes each time or if you don have time to read the book there 30 minute video on amazon with the same title same author as the book it so helpful babies also have 45 minute sleep cycles or something like that you should be able watch the clock for sleep signals at 45 minutes then hours at first yawn or eye rub feed them swaddle them crank up the white noise and let them snooze eventually your baby will be able to stay awake for hours or hours when they re closer to year old my first was colicky and would stay awake all day like yours it wasn good for her at all newborns need lots of sleep did the happiest baby routine and cut out dairy we also started probiotics and once we figured out the 45 minute sleep cycle thing naps got lot easier best of luck as others have said if it tough week just remember next week they ll be on to whole new stage you won notice it when it fresh but if you re curious you can put it in the fridge instead of freezing right away you ll notice that the fat layer will rise to the top the answers are unlimited gassy overtired reflux colic for our 12 day old it was colic reflux milk allergy if it continues to happen within the next couple of days bring it up to your pediatrician good luck our lo cried for hours non stop one night now he the most giggly smiley almost month old hang in there do you have fabric baby wrap exclusively pumped for my first and she was exactly like your baby what she craved was to be so extremely close to me would even wear it with just bra on because she needed my skin really highly recommend the boba wrap and watch the youtube videos on how to wrap them so you don get intimidated wrapped that baby for months to get her to sleep hard my second wasn as bad but absolutely loved being that close to me we have muslin wrap he hates his arms being wrapped but loves his body and legs wear padded nursing bra for skin to skin and do his tummy time skin to skin that really all he calmed down being on my chest yeah had few days like that at that age mine is 12 weeks they kinda suck at life sometimes but good thing—lo will do something completely different tomorrow it really is
